intro: Elyna stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit elyna, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that remains closed until maturity, releasing seeds through a specialized mechanism. Elyna stenocarpa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
